data: PED ED Clinical Decision Unit (CDU) Open Pathway

Patient meets INCLUSION criteria of at least ONE:  - Accidental ingestion requiring observation as per Poison Control  - Acute abdomen of possible surgical etiology  - Anaphylaxis  - Asthma (Greater than 18 months, Pediatric Respiratory Assessment Measure (PRAM) 4-8, Registered Nurse Initiated Activity (RNIA) protocol)  - Croup (requiring 2 doses of epinephrine)  - Dehydration due to gastroenteritis or cyclic vomiting and requiring IV rehydration less than 24 hours  - Alcohol intoxication  - Fever not yet diagnosed, greater than 12 months of age, requiring intervention  - Head injury  - Migraine (reports pain score greater than 4 at triage)  - Rule out myocarditis
If does not meet inclusion criteria, call ED Administration on call for further resolution if needed
